albert_einstein.name: Albert Einstein
albert_einstein.description: An influential theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, fundamentally shifting our understanding of space, time, and energy.

harriet_tubman.name: Harriet Tubman
harriet_tubman.description: An African American abolitionist and political activist who led hundreds of enslaved people to freedom via the Underground Railroad.

nikola_tesla.name: Nikola Tesla
nikola_tesla.description: A Serbian-American inventor and engineer who significantly contributed to the development of alternating current electrical systems, envisioned wireless communication, and held over 300 patents.

frida_kahlo.name: Frida Kahlo
frida_kahlo.description: A Mexican artist known for her surrealist and symbolic self-portraits and works that explored identity, gender, class, and race in Mexican society.

confucius.name: Confucius
confucius.description: An ancient Chinese philosopher whose teachings formed the basis of many aspects of East Asian culture and philosophy, emphasizing personal and governmental morality, correctness of social relationships, and justice.

amelia_earhart.name: Amelia Earhart
amelia_earhart.description: An American aviation pioneer and author, she was the first female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean, symbolizing the expanding roles of women in the early 20th century.

mahatma_gandhi.name: Mahatma Gandhi
mahatma_gandhi.description: Leader of Indian nationalism in British-ruled India, who employed nonviolent resistance to lead India to independence and inspired civil rights movements worldwide.

ada_lovelace.name: Ada Lovelace
ada_lovelace.description: An English mathematician and writer who is recognized for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine, and is often regarded as the first computer programmer.

virginia_woolf.name: Virginia Woolf
virginia_woolf.description: An English writer and one of the foremost modernists of the twentieth century, Woolf's works have significantly influenced feminist criticism and she is celebrated for her innovative narrative techniques.

nelson_mandela.name: Nelson Mandela
nelson_mandela.description: An anti-apartheid revolutionary, political leader, and philanthropist, who served as President of South Africa, and whose leadership, resilience, and advocacy for equality and justice transformed his nation.

zora_neale_hurston.name: Zora Neale Hurston
zora_neale_hurston.description: An American author, anthropologist, and filmmaker, who portrayed racial struggles in the early-20th-century American South and published research on Haitian voodoo.

carl_sagan.name: Carl Sagan
carl_sagan.description: An American astronomer, planetary scientist, cosmologist, astrophysicist, astrobiologist, author, and science communicator known for his research in extraterrestrial life, and for popularizing science to the public.

cleopatra.name: Cleopatra
cleopatra.description: Last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt

queen_victoria.name: Queen Victoria
queen_victoria.description: Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland from 1837 until her death

marie_curie.name: Marie Curie
marie_curie.description: Polish and naturalized-French physicist and chemist

isaac_newton.name: Isaac Newton
isaac_newton.description: English mathematician, physicist, astronomer, theologian, and author

maya_angelou.name: Maya Angelou
maya_angelou.description: An American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist, she is best known for her series of seven autobiographies, which focus on her childhood and early adult experiences, the first and most famous of which is 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'.

leonardo_da_vinci.name: Leonardo da Vinci
leonardo_da_vinci.description: Italian polymath of the High Renaissance who is widely considered one of the most diversely talented individuals ever to have lived

louis_pasteur.name: Louis Pasteur
louis_pasteur.description: French biologist, microbiologist and chemist renowned for his discoveries of the principles of vaccination, microbial fermentation and pasteurization

the_easter_bunny.name: The Easter Bunny
the_easter_bunny.description: A folkloric figure and symbol of Easter, depicted as a rabbit bringing Easter eggs

the_tooth_fairy.name: The Tooth Fairy
the_tooth_fairy.description: A fantasy figure of early childhood in Western and Western-influenced cultures

santa_claus.name: Santa Claus
santa_claus.description: A legendary figure originating in Western Christian culture who is said to bring gifts to the homes of well-behaved children on the night of Christmas Eve

robin_hood.name: Robin Hood
robin_hood.description: A heroic outlaw in English folklore who, according to legend, was a highly skilled archer and swordsman

sherlock_holmes.name: Sherlock Holmes
sherlock_holmes.description: A fictional private detective created by British author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

dracula.name: Dracula
dracula.description: A vampire who is fabled to haunt the Carpathian Mountains
